metadata.title: CVE-2024-26638 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nbd:always initialize struct msghdr completely syzbot complains thatmsg->msg_get_inq value can be uninitialized [1] struct msghdr got many newfields recently, we should always make sure their values is zero bydefault. [1] BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value in tcp_recvmsg+0x686/0xac0net/ipv4/tcp.c:2571 tcp_recvmsg+0x686/0xac0 net/ipv4/tcp.c:2571inet_recvmsg+0x131/0x580 net/ipv4/af_inet.c:879 sock_recvmsg_nosecnet/socket.c:1044 [inline] sock_recvmsg+0x12b/0x1e0 net/socket.c:1066__sock_xmit+0x236/0x5c0 drivers/block/nbd.c:538 nbd_read_replydrivers/block/nbd.c:732 [inline] recv_work+0x262/0x3100drivers/block/nbd.c:863 process_one_work kernel/workqueue.c:2627 [inline]process_scheduled_works+0x104e/0x1e70 kernel/workqueue.c:2700worker_thread+0xf45/0x1490 kernel/workqueue.c:2781 kthread+0x3ed/0x540kernel/kthread.c:388 ret_from_fork+0x66/0x80 arch/x86/kernel/process.c:147ret_from_fork_asm+0x11/0x20 arch/x86/entry/entry_64.S:242 Local variablemsg created at: __sock_xmit+0x4c/0x5c0 drivers/block/nbd.c:513nbd_read_reply drivers/block/nbd.c:732 [inline] recv_work+0x262/0x3100drivers/block/nbd.c:863 CPU: 1 PID: 7465 Comm: kworker/u5:1 Not tainted6.7.0-rc7-syzkaller-00041-gf016f7547aee #0 Hardware name: Google GoogleCompute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOS Google 11/17/2023 Workqueue:nbd5-recv recv_work

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic-64k - 6.5.0-41.41
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-azure - 6.5.0-1022.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-gcp - 6.5.0-1022.24
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1017-laptop - 6.5.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency - 6.5.0-41.41.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-41.41.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1018-raspi - 6.5.0-1018.21
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1015-starfive - 6.5.0-1015.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41').
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.23').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.24').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1017.20').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1018.21').
linux-starfive package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1015.16').
